subject: RE: [junit] "Bug in JUnit MoneyBag.java example?" found by Jamie Andrews
msgSnippet: Kevin, How embarrassing. Good catch. It ll be fixed by the end of the day. I would like to see a paper with lots of screen shots describing the steps you took
messageBody:
Kevin,

How embarrassing. Good catch. It'll be fixed by the end of the day.

I would like to see a paper with lots of screen shots describing the steps
you took to find this defect. I think this is a fairly common scenario--you
think the code works and is tested but then you find a case where it
doesn't. If you would like a co-author, I'll be glad to help.

Take care,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute and Agitar Software (makers of the tool that found
this defect)

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Kevin Lawrence
> Sent: Tuesday, July 19, 2005 11:49 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] "Bug in JUnit MoneyBag.java example?"
> found by Jamie Andrews
>
> Kent Beck wrote:
> > Elliotte,
> >
> > The defect is that implementations of IMoney are supposed
> to be immutable
> > and appendTo() allows callers to side effect the parameter.
> Fixing it
> > "properly", however, would require a private interface or
> an abstract class,
> > neither of which seem warranted to me in this situation.
> >
> > I'm interested in the tool that discovered the defect. Does
> anyone have more
> > information?
> >
>
> I couldn't find any specific information but the second link on this
> page sounds like a candidate.
>
>
> BTW this test ....
>
> public void testZeroMoniesAreEqualRegardlessOfCurrency() {
> Money zeroDollars = new Money(0, "USD");
> Money zeroFrancs = new Money(0, "CHF");
>
> assertEquals(zeroDollars, zeroFrancs);
> assertEquals(zeroDollars.hashCode(), zeroFrancs.hashCode());
> }
>
>
> ... would increase the coverage of the equals method and
> fails because
> equals() special cases zero but hashCode() does not.
>
> I found this bug with my company's tool ;-)
>
> Kevin
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
>
